title: RedHawks hold steady in polls
text:
RedHawks hold steady in polls 
Updated: Mon, Oct 26 2015, 03:17 PM 
OXFORD, Ohio (WKRC) -- A split this past weekend at St. Lawrence resulted in the Miami University hockey team holding strong in both major polls this week.The RedHawks remained at 14th in the USCHO.com poll and 15th in the USA Today/USA Hockey Magazine poll.The RedHawks are one of six National Collegiate Hockey Conference teams ranked in both of the major polls. Like last week, North Dakota holds the top spot in the USCHO.com poll while coming in at second in the USA Today/USA Hockey Magazine Poll. On the flip side, Omaha comes in ranked second in the USCHO.com Poll and first in the USA Today/USA Hockey Magazine Poll. Rounding out the ranked NCHC teams are No. 5/5 Denver, No. 6/6 Minnesota-Duluth, and No. 14/13 St. Cloud State.The RedHawks open up NCHC action this weekend as they travel to St. Cloud State to take on the Huskies. Image and information courtesy Miami Univ Athletics Related Stories
